details.title: West Bengal government measures to maintain normal life on Bharat Bandh
details.content: The West Bengal government has taken a slew of measures to maintain normal life and foil an opposition Congress and Left parties-called 'Bharat Bandh' on Monday to protest high fuel prices and depreciation of the rupee.

Ninan Thomas, Jacob George of Kerala forced to walk till @aaibpiairport due to blockade by Congress activists @NewIndianXpress #BharathBandh pic.twitter.com/yWbbFbUy94

— Asish Mehta (@Asish_TNIE) September 10, 2018

Protesters block taxis entering the city from airport on #BharathBandh.

Cabs going to the airport won’t be affected as police assure they won’t cause trouble to passengers. @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/LFAueHO1xh

— Pushkar_TNIE (@pushkarv) September 10, 2018

Jan Adhikar Party Loktantrik workers block railway tracks in Patna's Rajendra Nagar Terminal railway station in support to #BharatBandh that has been called by Congress and other opposition parties today over fuel price hike. pic.twitter.com/tFTmCOrXqe

— ANI (@ANI) September 10, 2018

#BharatBandh: Mixed response in #WestBengal; CITU workers forcibly stop buses in #Asansol, #Congress workers clash with cops in #Howrah. Traffic normal in Kolkata, addl police forces deployed. @AITCofficial supported cause against fuel price rise but not strike. @NewIndianXpress

details.title: Security has been tightened in Jaipur over Bharat Bandh
details.content: Police says, "Precautionary measures have been taken. Police have been directed to take stringent actions against the protesters who will restore to violence during protests."

details.content: (Photo | Parveen Negi)

Madhya Pradesh fuel pumps to remain open, says owners' association.

details.title: Petrol price crosses Rs 88/litre mark in Mumbai, diesel hovering at Rs 77.32/litre
details.content: The petrol and diesel prices saw a hike of 23 and 22 paise per litre respectively in Delhi. On the other hand, Mumbai is affected most with the hike as petrol and diesel are being sold at Rs 88.12 and Rs 77.32 per litre.
Bus services in Bengaluru and across the state were paralysed as over one lakh employees of four state road transport corporations, including BMTC and KSRTC.

details.title: Bharat Bandh: Heading to Kempegowda International Airport? Watch out
details.content: Members of the Airport Taxi Owners’ Association have threatened to block the road leading to Kempegowda International Airport as part of the protest on Monday which is scheduled to be in effect from 9 am to 3 pm.

details.title: Mumbai Metro says services have been restored
details.content:
Dear Passengers,

Metro services were disrupted for a short period on account of protests by political parties. However, the issue has been resolved and services have been restored. We hope you have a nice day.

#Congress workers and bandh supporters block National Highway-16 in #Bhubaneswar by burning tyres. #BharatBandh#FuelProtests@NewIndianXpress@Siba_TNIE pic.twitter.com/LOIsLpVIrh

details.title: Opposition's Bharat Bandh against rising fuel prices evokes mixed response in J-K
details.content: A day-long Bharat Bandh or nationwide shutdown called by the Congress and Left parties to protest rising fuel prices evoked a mixed response in Jammu and Kashmir on Monday.

details.title: Rail, road traffic hit in Bihar during Opposition shutdown against fuel price hike
details.content: Hundreds of Congress and other opposition parties leaders and workers took to the streets since early Monday in different parts of Bihar.
Bharat Bandh largely successful across Karnataka, mixed response in Bengaluru

'Bharat' will not be 'bandh', it will keep moving and progressing. No one is paying heed to this call by Congress, their 'Mahagatbandhan' balloon will also burst soon: Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi,Union Minister pic.twitter.com/tKwQpemUuN

— ANI (@ANI) September 10, 2018
Offices, schools and colleges open at regular time in Delhi

details.title: Manmohan Singh hits out at Modi government as oil prices skyrocket
details.content: Leaders of various opposition parties led by Congress president Rahul Gandhi kickstarted Monday the country-wide protest against rising fuel prices from Rajghat as part of the 'Bharat Bandh' call given by the party.

details.title: Partial shutdown in Himachal Pradesh against rising fuel prices
details.content: Banks and commercial establishments were largely opened while shops in some towns of Himachal Pradesh were closed on Monday on the protest call by the Congress over the rise in fuel prices.

details.title: Opposition blocks railway in Mumbai to protest rising fuel prices
details.content: As petrol prices on Monday shot up to Rs 89.97 in Maharashtra's Parbhani - the highest in India - the Opposition Congress staged a 'rail-roko' agitation here as part of the party-sponsored nationwide shutdown to protest rising fuel prices.

Frustrated opposition doesn't have any strategy and leadership,what else can be expected from them? I hope God gives them sense so they can differentiate between positive & negative otherwise in future they will even lose their position as Opposition: UP CM Yogi Adityanath

#BharatBandh
Commuters face trouble as #Congress activists block major roads in #Bhubaneswar pic.twitter.com/DO877q8SH1

— Sudarsan Maharana (@Sud_TNIE) September 10, 2018

The BJP government is so proud of themselves that even today when the Opposition has called for a 'bandh' they have increased fuel price in some places. Government can even say that inflation will bring development: Former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav

Everyone has a right to protest but what is happening today? Petrol pumps and buses being set ablaze, putting to risk lives. A child died after an ambulance was stuck in the protests in Bihar's Jehanabad. Who is responsible?: Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad

Bihar: The death of the child is not related to bandh or traffic jam, the relatives had left late from their home: SDO Jehanabad Paritosh Kumar on reports that a two-year-old patient died after the vehicle was stuck in Bharat Bandh protests

Bihar: The death of the child is not related to bandh or traffic jam, the relatives had left late from their home: SDO Jehanabad Paritosh Kumar on reports that a two-year-old patient died after the vehicle was stuck in Bharat Bandh protests

details.title: Opposition workers stage protests across Andhra Pradesh, held
details.content: While the Congress gave the bandh call to protest the rise in prices of petroleum products, Left parties and Jana Sena also joined in support.

details.title: Bharat Bandh against fuel price hike evokes mixed response in Telangana
details.content: The 'Bharat Bandh' call given by several opposition parties over rising petrol and diesel prices Monday evoked a mixed response as it was business as usual in many parts of the state, including Hyderabad.

details.title: Bandh supporters in Bihar indulge in arson, vandalism
details.content: JAP workers smashed glasses of the bus at Rajendra Nagar terminal as the bus was parked there and was supposed to transport employees of East Central Railway to ECR zonal headquarters in Hajipur later.

details.title: Normal life largely unaffected in Tamil Nadu
details.content: Normal life largely remained unaffected here Monday in view of the 'Bharat Bandh' called by the Congress to protest the rising prices of petroleum products, as the public transport operated smoothly while most commercial establishments remained open.

details.title: 58 Congress activists taken into custody in Jharkhand
details.content: Fifty-eight Congress activists including Palamau district Congress president Jaias Ranjan Pathak were taken into custody for forcibly trying to enforce the bandh, Superintendent of Police Inderjeet Mahata said.

details.title: Bharat Bandh against Rising fuel prices evokes partial response in Uttar Pradesh
details.content: While shops and other business establishments were closed in some parts of the state, life was normal in most of the areas, including the state capital.

I feel that the macroeconomic price for petrol is Rs 40 and somehow the PM must ask the Petroleum Minister to think as a part of Economic Affairs Ministry& not as Petroleum minister and stop setting prices so high that people can go to the point of revolt: Subramanian Swamy, BJP pic.twitter.com/fwJ7b2lbmv

— ANI (@ANI) September 10, 2018

details.title: Bharat Bandh: Women's Commission member Shahida Kamal attacked
details.content: Women's Commission member Shahida Kamal was attacked allegedly by Congress workers at Neduthery in Kollam, as the state observes Bharat Bandh.

details.title: Toddler dies en route to hospital in Bihar
details.content:
An ailing two-year-old girl who was being rushed to a hospital in Bihar’s Jehanabad died on the way as the ambulance she was in was allegedly stuck in an impenetrable jam caused by protesters.

2-yr-old girl dies on way to hospital in #Bihar's #Jehanabad as ambulance is stuck in jam caused by #BharatBandh protesters @NewIndianXpress

@ncbn slashes Rs 2 per litre on #petrol & #diesel effective from Tuesday morning @NewIndianXpress

Karnataka bus services in Davanagere, Chamarajnagar, Kolar, Kolar Gold Fields, Bengaluru, Shimoga and Tumkur have now resumed.

#AP govt to incur a revenue loss of Rs 1120 crore with the slashing of #petrol and #diesel prices by Rs 2 per litre; slashed prices to come into effect from Tuesday @NewIndianXpress

— Phareesh_TNIE (@Phareesh_tnie) September 10, 2018

Why was there a Bharat Bandh in the first place? If you listen to the 2012 speeches of those in power today, they were shouting about petrol&diesel prices. Today the prices are surpassing prices of that time, Rupee has weakened against Dollar. We are in trouble: Farooq Abdullah to ANI

#BJP welcomes #AP govt move to slash Rs 2 per litre on #petrol and #diesel but asks govt to cut down on #VAT imposed on fuel which is on higher side in the state; VAT imposed on fuel is 24% in the state @NewIndianXpress

— Phareesh_TNIE (@Phareesh_tnie) September 10, 2018

Today’s Bharat Bandh has been successful across the country. Congress party has never held Bharat Bandh before, we don’t even believe in Bharat Bandh, but since the time Modi govt has come there has been a situation that led to this: Ashok Gehlot, Congress

The Bharat Bandh was peaceful in the state, 110-115 people have been arrested. The numbers can rise. In Ujjain, Katni and Jabalpur there had been some incidents for which cases have been registered: Makrand Deuskar, IG Law & Order, Madhya Pradesh on #BharatBandh pic.twitter.com/wqzk9ojqPz

— ANI (@ANI) September 10, 2018
